skill.name: core-components
skill.description: Core component library and design system patterns. Use when building UI, using design tokens, or working with the component library.
skill.summary: Core component library and design system patterns. Use when building UI, using design tokens, or wor...
skill.author: ChrisWiles

security_audit.summary: This skill is pure documentation with code examples. No executable code, network calls, file access, or external command execution. Contains only design system patterns and component usage guidelines.

content.value_statement: Building UI without a design system leads to inconsistent styling and hard-to-maintain code. This skill provides reusable component patterns and design tokens for consistent, maintainable user interfaces.
actual_capabilities: Apply design tokens for spacing, colors, and typography
Use core components like Box, HStack, VStack, Text, Button
Build consistent screen layouts with design system patterns
Create accessible form layouts with proper spacing
Implement component variants and prop patterns
Avoid common anti-patterns like hard-coded values
limitations: Does not generate new components automatically
Does not integrate with specific UI frameworks beyond general patterns
Does not provide runtime component library implementation

use_cases.title: Build consistent UI
use_cases.description: Apply design tokens and component patterns to create unified user interfaces across your application

use_cases.title: Document design patterns
use_cases.description: Translate design specifications into consistent component implementations using semantic tokens

use_cases.title: Create style guides
use_cases.description: Document component usage patterns and design token conventions for development teams

prompt_templates.title: Basic Button
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to create a Button component using design tokens for padding and variant styling

prompt_templates.title: Layout Structure
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I structure a screen layout with header, content area, and consistent spacing using VStack and tokens

prompt_templates.title: Form Design
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a form layout with labeled Input components, proper gap spacing, and validation state handling

prompt_templates.title: Custom Component
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a custom Card component that extends Box with variant support and token-based props

output_examples.input: Create a list item with avatar, title, subtitle, and chevron icon
output: Use HStack with gap and alignItems center for the row layout
Avatar component with size prop for consistent sizing
VStack with flex 1 for the text area
Text components with fontSize and color tokens for hierarchy
Icon with color token from $textTertiary for subtle visual

best_practices: Always use design tokens instead of hard-coded values for colors, spacing, and typography
Import core components from your component library instead of using raw platform components
Apply semantic tokens like $textPrimary and $statusSuccess for accessible, theme-aware styling
anti_patterns: Hard-coding pixel values or color hex codes instead of using design tokens
Using raw platform components like View or Text from react-native instead of core components
Applying inline styles with style prop instead of using token-based component props

faq.question: Which platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for all component pattern guidance.

faq.question: What design tokens are available?
faq.answer: Spacing tokens from $1 to $8, color tokens for text and status, and typography tokens from $xs to $2xl.

faq.question: How do I integrate with my existing component library?
faq.answer: Replace the example component imports with your library's exports. The patterns remain the same.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill contains only documentation and code patterns. No data is collected or transmitted.

faq.question: Why should I avoid hard-coded values?
faq.answer: Hard-coded values break design consistency, make theme changes difficult, and cause maintenance issues.

faq.question: How does this compare to styled-components or CSS-in-JS?
faq.answer: This skill provides pattern guidance compatible with any styling approach. Design tokens work with inline styles, CSS-in-JS, or native styling systems.
